title: Westfalenstadion - Wikipedia
snippet: Westfalenstadion (German pronunciation: [vɛstˈfaːlənˌʃtaːdi̯ɔn] ⓘ, lit. 'Westphalia stadium') is a football stadium in Dortmund, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany, which is the home stadium of Borussia Dortmund.

title: Borussia Dortmund celebrate 50 years of the Westfalenstadion | Bundesliga
snippet: Known worldwide for its iconic Yellow Wall, Borussia Dortmund marked 50 years of the Westfalenstadion prior to their Matchday 28 meeting with VfB Stuttgart. The home of German and European champions, the 81,365-capacity arena has created more ...

title: Borussia Dortmund - Wikipedia
snippet: Since 1974, Dortmund have played their home games at the Westfalenstadion; the stadium is the largest in Germany, the Yellow Wall, a standing terrace in the South Stand, is the largest of its kind in Europe, and Dortmund has the highest average attendance of any association football club in ...

title: Signal Iduna Park the home of Borussia Dortmund | Around The Grounds
snippet: Westfalenstadion is a football stadium in Dortmund, Germany, which is the home of Borussia Dortmund. Officially called Signal Iduna Park for sponsorship reasons. The stadium is one of the most famous football grounds in Europe and is renowned ...

title: Stadium Guide: Westfalenstadion (Borussia Dortmund) | Jobs In Football
snippet: Home of "The Yellow Wall", Borussia Dortmund's Westfalonstadion is one of the largest and most renowned stadiums in Europe, with an atmosphere to match any across the globe. Here we take a look at some of it's main features and facilities.
